body_html:
Thanks @sherrym and it helps a lot.

But I have another question. If the target is always "localhost", how can the client which is in another host connect with this server? We can specify the "server.target" when initializing "Session" but it doesn't work to connect with "www.a.com:2222" or the ip.

If the server.target has to be localhost:$post, the client has to be in the same host with the worker. Is that right?
body_text:

But I have another question. If the target is always "localhost", how can the client which is in another host connect with this server? We can specify the "server.target" when initializing "Session" but it doesn't work to connect with "www.a.com:2222" or the ip.
If the server.target has to be localhost:$post, the client has to be in the same host with the worker. Is that right?
body:
Thanks @sherrym and it helps a lot.

But I have another question. If the target is always "localhost", how can the client which is in another host connect with this server? We can specify the "server.target" when initializing "Session" but it doesn't work to connect with "www.a.com:2222" or the ip.

If the `server.target` has to be `localhost:$post`, the client has to be in the same host with the worker. Is that right?
